result.execSummary:
All charges against Joseph L McLaurin in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph L McLaurin is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:15 AM Defendant Joseph L McLaurin in court, in custody.  Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court for Joseph L McLaurin.  Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
State moves to dismiss and gives statement as to why. 
Defense has no objection. 
BTC: Case dismissed.
Racine County Alternatives Program - Violation Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

9:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph L McLaurin in court, in custody.  Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court for Joseph L McLaurin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense requests to be heard on bond today. 
State indicates there are no notice issues and can proceed today. 
Defense gives statement as to request to modify bond. 
State doesn't object to signature at this time. 
BTC: BOND MODIFICATION: Granted, $2500 signature bond with same conditions.
Status conference scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
